subject: RE: [junit] Is there any way I can use a failed test invoke other function?
msgSnippet: If you want to report test failures, you could subclass TestResult and override addFailure() and addError, or you could attach a TestListener to an existing
messageBody:
If you want to report test failures, you could subclass TestResult and
override addFailure() and addError, or you could attach a TestListener to an
existing TestResult. This will require you to write your own test runner of
some sort, but a simple runner is not complex. It can be as simple as:

Test suite= createMyTestSuite();
TestResult result= new TestResult();
result.addListener(new MyTestListener());
suite.run(result);

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute
